events.message: The applicant submitted the initial personal loan application to cover expenses for a planned wedding ceremony and related events.
Loan department reviewed the application and categorised it under personal loans due to the nature of expenses including wedding and small travel costs.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to facilitate a faster review process and assist the applicant with necessary documentation.
Initial review of the application indicated that all basic eligibility criteria were met. Additional documents would be required for further processing.
The loan officer requested proof of income, a credit report authorization, and an estimate of wedding expenses to assess loan viability.
The applicant submitted all requested documents including pay slips, bank statements, and a detailed budget for the wedding event.
Credit check was completed successfully showing a good credit score and no outstanding debts, which supports loan approval possibilities.
Risk team evaluated the application and found the risk to be acceptable given the applicant’s stable income and positive credit history.
The loan offer was presented to the applicant including details on loan amount, interest rate, and repayment schedule tailored to wedding expenses.
Applicant replied positively to the offer, confirming understanding of terms and requested minor clarifications on repayment options.
Application was escalated to senior loan officers for final review due to the loan amount being near the upper limit for personal loans.
Senior officers approved the loan application based on thorough assessment and confirmation that applicant meets all conditions.
Funds were successfully transferred to the applicant’s bank account to support the upcoming wedding and related financial needs.
Loan officer contacted the applicant to ensure that the funds were received and to provide guidance on repayment schedules.
The loan case was officially closed after confirming that all steps were completed successfully and applicant was satisfied.
